{"id":415191195,"lang":"python3","time":"8Â months","timestamp":1604144249,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"76 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/415191195/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Recover Binary Search Tree","memory":"14.4 MB","code":"# Definition for a binary tree node.\n# class TreeNode:\n#     def __init__(self, val=0, left=None, right=None):\n#         self.val = val\n#         self.left = left\n#         self.right = right\nfrom math import inf\n\nclass Solution:\n    def recoverTree(self, root: TreeNode) -> None:\n        \"\"\"\n        Do not return anything, modify root in-place instead.\n        \"\"\"\n        def inOrder(node, arr):\n            if not node:\n                return\n            inOrder(node.left, arr)\n            arr.append(node)\n            inOrder(node.right, arr)\n        \n        arr = []\n        inOrder(root, arr)\n        n = len(arr)\n        for i in range(n - 1):\n            if arr[i].val > arr[i + 1].val:\n                low = arr[i + 1]\n                for j in range(i + 1, n):\n                    low = min(low, arr[j], key=lambda x: x.val)\n                arr[i].val, low.val = low.val, arr[i].val\n                break\n        return root\n        ","compare_result":"","title_slug":"recover-binary-search-tree"}
